name: Daniel Crooks

roles_in_work.title: Time slice 2002: recent spatial and temporal displacement experiments
Daniel Crooks documentation of recent work 31-01-04

biography:
Born 1973 New Zealand, lives and works in Melbourne.
Employing a complex range of techniques - stop motion animation, time lapse and precision camera motion control - the surreal, elegant films and photography of Daniel Crooks have exhibited both locally and internationally. In 2002, his solo show Time Lapse was held at the Centre for Contemporary Photography, Melbourne and his work was exhibited at the Museum of Contemporary Art, Sydney, and ZKM in Germany. A graduate of the Auckland Institute of Technology and the Victorian College of the Arts School of Film and Television, Crooks has received numerous awards including the City of Stuttgart Prize for Animation, and a Dendy Australian Short Film Award at the 1996 Sydney International Film Festival.

(FT 30.03.05)
